pgTitle: List of American Civil War Medal of Honor recipients: G–L

rows.text: Error: 1862 Jun 27 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Dec 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag, of 44th Mississippi Infantry (C.S.A.).
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry as color bearer in the assault on Fort Gregg.
Error: 1865 Jan 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Nereus during the attack on Fort Fisher, on 15 January 1865.
Error: 1863 Nov 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 May 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
While color bearer, rallied the retreating troops and induced them to check the enemy's advance.
Error: 1865 Apr 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 May 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily and at the risk of his life carried orders to the brigade commander, which resulted in saving the works his regiment was defending.
Error: 1864 Oct 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

While an escaped prisoner of war within the enemy's lines witnessed an important movement of the enemy, and at great personal risk made his way through the enemy's lines and brought news of the movement to Sherman's army.
Error: 1862 Dec 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily seized the colors after several color bearers had been shot down and led the regiment in the charge.
Error: 1863 Nov 20 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Having voluntarily accompanied a small party to destroy buildings within the enemy's lines whence sharpshooters had been firing, disregarded an order to retire, remained and completed the firing of the buildings, thus insuring their total destruction; this at the imminent risk of his life from the fire of the advancing enemy.
Error: 1864 Nov 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag supposed to be of Cheatham's Corps (C.S.A.).
Error: 1862 July 9 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served as second-class fireman on board the U.S.S. Ceres in the fight near Hamilton, Roanoke River, 9 July 1862.
Error: 1863 Nov 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Sprang over the works just captured from the enemy, and calling upon his comrades to follow, rushed forward in the face of a deadly fire and was among the first over the works on the summit, where he compelled the surrender of a Confederate officer and received his sword.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantly seized the colors, which had fallen near the enemy's lines of abatis, raised them and rallied the men at a time of confusion and in a place of the greatest danger.
Error: 1865 Mar 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Aug 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 May 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 31st North Carolina (C.S.A.) in a personal encounter.
Error: 1863 May 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily led the company in a charge and was the first to enter the enemy's works, taking a number of prisoners.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served as coxswain on board the U.S.S. Oneida in the engagement at Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Brooklyn during action against rebel forts and gunboats and with the ram Tennessee, in Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864.
Error: 1864 Jun 11 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Remained at his gun, resisting with its implements the advancing cavalry, and thus secured the retreat of his detachment.
Error: 1862 May 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

On board the U.S.S. Galena in the attack upon Drewry's Bluff, 15 May 1862. Severely burned while extricating a priming wire which had become bent and fixed in the bow gun while his ship underwent terrific shelling from the enemy, Kenyon hastily dressed his hands with cotton waste and oil and courageously returned to his gun while enemy sharpshooters in rifle pits along the banks continued to direct their fire at the men at the guns.
Error: 1862 May 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of battle flag of 50th Georgia Infantry (C.S.A.).
Error: 1863 May 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily and at the risk of his life, under a severe fire of the enemy, aided and assisted to the rear an officer who had been severely wounded and left on the field.
Error: 1864 Aug 7 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Nov 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Waved the colors to save the lives of the men who were being fired upon by their own batteries, and thereby drew upon himself a concentrated fire from the enemy.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 6th North Carolina Infantry (C.S.A.).
Error: 1864 May 12 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 28th North Carolina Infantry. (C.S.A.).
Error: 1865 Mar 31 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Carried orders to the reserve brigade and participated with it in the charge which repulsed the enemy.
Error: 1864 October 27 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1862 Jun 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
This officer, when his captain was wounded, succeeded to the command of two batteries while engaged against a superior force of the enemy and fought his guns most gallantly until compelled to retire.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served as a landsman on board the U.S.S. Lackawanna during successful attacks against Fort Morgan, rebel gunboats and the ram Tennessee in Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864.
Error: 1864 May 18 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Seized the colors, the color bearer having been shot, and with great gallantry succeeded in saving them from capture.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Seized the colors when the color bearer was killed and bore them himself in the assault.
Error: 1864 May 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Volunteered for dangerous service and single-handedly captured 13 armed Confederate soldiers and marched them to the rear.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Carried with others by hand a cannon up to and fired it through an embrasure of the enemy's works.
Error: 1864 July 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
In company with a sergeant, was the first to enter the exploded mine; was wounded but took several prisoners to the Federal lines.
Error: 1862 Apr This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

One of the 19 of 22 men (including 2 civilians) who, by direction of Gen. Mitchell (or Buell), penetrated nearly 200 miles south into enemy territory and captured a railroad train at Big Shanty, Ga., in an attempt to destroy the bridges and track between Chattanooga and Atlanta.
Error: 1861 Jul 21 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Removed dead and wounded under heavy fire.
Error: 1863 Jul 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Held his ground with the battery after the other batteries had fallen back until compelled to draw his piece off by hand; he was severely wounded.
Error: 1865 Apr 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Nov 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Seized a musket and joined in the charge in which he was severely wounded.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Took one of the first prisoners, a captain
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Carried with others by hand a cannon up to and fired it through an embrasure of the enemy's works.
Error: 1865 Mar 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Sep 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 8th and 19th Arkansas (C.S.A.).
